title: Potential-Heads
text: divisions (KTH -> School -> Department (sv: Institution) -> Division (sv: Avdelning)) ?
code: # get some relevant schools and departments ksd <-    kth_school_dep()  %>%    mutate(is_excluded = ifelse(nchar(stringr::str_match(slug, "t|vg|zaa")) > 0, TRUE, FALSE)) %>%   # retain just the deps and non-excluded slugs   filter(is.na(is_excluded)) %>%    arrange(-desc(slug)) %>%    select(slug, desc = `description.en`)  knitr::kable(ksd %>% slice(1:5)) # use one of the slugs  ai <-    kth_catalog(slug = "a/ai")  # users can now be enumerated, for example: #knitr::kable(ai$users %>% slice(1:5))  # divisions can be enumerated for each of the departments, for example:  ai$catalog %>%    select(slug, `description.en`, kthid) %>%   knitr::kable()

what: Organizational belonging for a given KTH user account or kthid
title: Schools-Departments-from-KTH-Directory-API
text: Given account name “kthid”, can look organizational belonging? Via called “Legacy Profile API v 1.1” now looked tjep belongs organizational unit KTH LIBRARY, second level (institutional level) organizational hierarchy. function wraps calls returns data frame provided convenience: kth_profile_legacy() function returns field called worksFor.name-en represents lowest level (often level 4) organizational unit name, sometimes provided Swedish instead English, directly used determine institutional belonging.
code: library(kthapi) library(dplyr)  user <- "tjep" unit_codes <- kth_profile_school_dep(user)  # organizational belonging for user "tjep" unit_codes #> [1] "t"    "tr"   "trac"  # use the first two levels of the hierarchy slug <- paste0(collapse = "/", unit_codes[1:2])  # look up the english lang description for this "slug" unit2 <-    kth_school_dep() %>%    inner_join(tibble(slug = slug)) %>%   select(slug, desc = `description.en`) %>%   pull(desc)  unit2 #> [1] "KTH LIBRARY" kth_belonging_institutional("hoyce") #> Error: The API returned an error: Not found

title: Schools-Departments-from-KTH-Directory-API
text: KTH schools departments (case first two levels org hierarchy) can retrieved kth_school_dep(). listing exclude kthid identifier, exists also organizational units.
code: kth_school_dep() %>%  #  filter(is.na(`_id`)) %>%   mutate(row = 1:nrow(.)) %>%   select(row, slug, desc = `description.en`, website) %>%   knitr::kable()

title: Authors and Citation
text: Gaël Dubus. Author. Agne Larsson. Author. Markus Skyttner. Maintainer, author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Dubus G, Larsson , Skyttner M (2025). kthapi: Data KTH APIs. R package version 0.1.2, https://kth-library.github.io/kthapi/, https://github.com/KTH-Library/kthapi.
code: @Manual{,   title = {kthapi: Data from KTH APIs},   author = {Gaël Dubus and Agne Larsson and Markus Skyttner},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.2, https://kth-library.github.io/kthapi/},   url = {https://github.com/KTH-Library/kthapi}, }

title: Data from KTH APIs
text: goal kthapi R package provide API wrapper APIs used KTH, Royal Institute Technology, can used directly R. KTH APIs described : https://www.kth.se/api/anvand-data-fran-kth-1.57059 KTH APIs provide information employee profiles, published web content, places, course schemas program catalogues. R package interfaces API, making data available use directly R.

title: Data from KTH APIs
text: can install development version kthapi GitHub :

title: Data from KTH APIs
text: API wrapper / client pre-configured set API endpoints: basic example shows make lookup using v 1.1 “legacy” Profiles API, get contact information KTH employee using account name:
code: library(kthapi) library(knitr) suppressPackageStartupMessages(library(dplyr)) profile <-    kth_profile_legacy("tjep") %>%    .$content   # inspect this record profile %>% glimpse() #> Rows: 1 #> Columns: 12 #> $ givenName          <chr> "Tobias" #> $ familyName         <chr> "Jeppsson" #> $ url                <chr> "https://www.kth.se/profile/tjep" #> $ email              <chr> "tjep@kth.se" #> $ image              <chr> "https://www.kth.se/files/avatar/tjep" #> $ telephone          <chr> "087907106" #> $ jobTitle           <chr> "Bibliometrisk analytiker" #> $ `jobTitle-en`      <chr> "Librarian" #> $ workLocation       <chr> "OSQUARS BACKE 31" #> $ worksFor.url       <chr> "https://www.kth.se/directory/t/tr/trac" #> $ worksFor.name      <chr> "PUBLICERINGENS INFRASTRUKTUR" #> $ `worksFor.name-en` <chr> "PUBLICATION INFRASTRUCTURE AND MEDIA"  # pivot into long format and display as a table profile %>% t() %>% as.data.frame() %>%     cbind(rownames(.)) %>% setNames(nm = c("value", "key")) %>% as_tibble() %>%   select(key, value) %>%   kable() # NB: some valid account names do not return data tryCatch(kth_profile_legacy("markussk"), error = function(e) e) #> <KTH API call for markussk> #> # A tibble: 0 × 10 #> # ℹ 10 variables: givenName <chr>, familyName <chr>, url <chr>, email <chr>, #> #   image <chr>, telephone <chr>, jobTitle <chr>, jobTitle-en <chr>, #> #   worksFor <list>, workLocation <chr>

title: Data from KTH APIs
text: basic example shows make lookup using authenticated Profiles API: usage examples, please see package vignettes.
code: profile <-    kth_profile(username = "tjep") %>%   .$content  # organizational belonging profile$worksFor$items %>%    tibble::as_tibble() %>%   select(path, name, nameEn) %>%   knitr::kable() # corresponding "slugs" profile$worksFor$items$path #> [1] "t/tr"      "t/tr/trac"  # displayname used in ABM app kth_displayname("tjep", type = "username") #> [1] "Tobias Jeppsson (tjep)"  # NB: this (authenticated API call) does not throw an error for non-employees kth_displayname("markussk", type = "username") #> [1] "Markus Skyttner (markussk)"

what: Classify into subject categories using SwePub Web API — classify_swepub
title: Classify into subject categories using SwePub Web API — classify_swepub
text: Use title, abstract keywords get suggestion subject categories use Swedish standard set 3 5 digit subject categories.

title: Classify into subject categories using SwePub Web API — classify_swepub
Classify into subject categories using SwePub Web API — classify_swepub
text: title title paper abstract abstract keywords keywords used level either 3 5, default: 3

title: Classify into subject categories using SwePub Web API — classify_swepub
text: Calls API https://swepub-qa.kb.se/api/v1/classify

title: Classify into subject categories using SwePub Web API — classify_swepub
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ classify_swepub(    title = "Magnetic resonance",    abstract = "This paper deals with magnetic resonance",    keywords = "magnetic radiotherapy nuclear",    level = 5 ) } # }

what: Classify a publication record by Swedish standard subject categories — classify_umu_ub
title: Classify a publication record by Swedish standard subject categories — classify_umu_ub
text: Umeå University provides web api described , classifying english swedish language records DiVA Swepub based MODS format (v 3.2 later) according Swedish standard. Classification can also made based Web Science record Uploaded record batches may exceed 200 MB, using batches 10 MB recommended (around 2-3000 records per chunk)

title: Classify a publication record by Swedish standard subject categories — classify_umu_ub
code: classify_umu_ub(   record,   type = c("mods", "wos"),   threshold = 0.2,   email = "foo.bar@null.se" )

title: Classify a publication record by Swedish standard subject categories — classify_umu_ub
text: record string publication identifier string DiVA export file Web Science "Plain text/Full record" format type string, type identifier, one "mods" "wos", default: "mods" threshold value 0.1 0.51, governs extent record classified one subject area email email adress user

title: Classify a publication record by Swedish standard subject categories — classify_umu_ub
text: tibble suggested classifications

title: Classify a publication record by Swedish standard subject categories — classify_umu_ub
text: classification based information record title abstract (required) also keywords, ISSN/journal, ISBN-prefix/ publisher affiliations. Training data comes SwePub (July 2020). based following papers: Dual Coordinate Descent Methods Logistic Regression Maximum Entropy Models. (doi:10.1007/s10994-010-5221-8 Entropy-Based Term Weighting Schemes Text Categorization VSM. (doi:10.1109/ICTAI.2015.57 classification made research topic level (5 digits) English language records research subject group level 3 digits Swedish language records.

title: Classify a publication record by Swedish standard subject categories — classify_umu_ub
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  # classify using a DiVA record identifier classify_umu_ub("diva2:515038", threshold = 0.3, email = "john.doe@hotmail.com")  # classify using a WoS Record in Flatfile/Plain text format wos_record <- readr::read_lines("https://klassificera.ub.umu.se/uploadFile.txt") classify_umu_ub(wos_record, type = "wos") } # }

title: KTH APIs configuration — config

title: KTH APIs configuration — config
KTH APIs configuration — config
text: Please edit ~./Renviron file set values environment variables KTH_API_KEY_DIRECTORY, KTH_API_KEY_PROFILES KTH_API_KEY_PUBLICATIONS can use file.edit("~/.Renviron"); readRenviron("~/.Renviron"))

title: KTH APIs configuration — config
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ if (interactive()) {  # how to change the config my_cfg <- config() my_cfg$ua <- httr::user_agent("My own user agent string") my_cfg$verbose <- TRUE  # then use this config when making calls kth_profile_legacy("tjep", config = my_cfg)  } } # }

what: Search Active Directory at KTH — ldap_search
title: Search Active Directory at KTH — ldap_search
text: function uses ldapsearch query KTH Active Directory. requires environment variables set .Renviron, specifically LDAP_USER, LDAP_PASS, LDAP_HOST LDAP_BASE service account used queries.

title: Search Active Directory at KTH — ldap_search
Search Active Directory at KTH — ldap_search
text: ldap_query LDAP query issue, 'ugKthid=*' ldap_attributes set attributes return, default NULL can character vector attributes, c('ugKthid', 'ugOrcid') cfg connection credentials, default given ldap_config()

title: Search Active Directory at KTH — ldap_search
text: tibble results

title: Search Active Directory at KTH — ldap_search
text: ldapsearch command makes use -E pr=2147483647/noprompt avoid paging returns results LDIF format parsed tibble. possible disable ldaps TLS require certificate check, setting environment variable LDAPTLS_REQCERT "never" (can done .Renviron)

title: Search Active Directory at KTH — ldap_search
